STBLKeyStringList.Text: Thank you for your donation. This knit is gorgeous and functional!
Thank you for your hat donation. This will surely keep someone's head warm!
Thank you for your toy donation! It is absolutely adorable, and so well made. A child is going to love this.
This onesie is just the cutest! So soft, and warm too. Thank you so much for your donation.
Thank you for donating this... strange round thing. Surely it will be of some use?
Thank you for your rug donation! There are ten toes out there that are going to be very happy to nestle into this cozy knit.
Thank you for donating socks. These are very valuable to the shelter. Please think of us if you have more socks to donate in the future.
Thank you so much for your sweater donation. The shelter can always use more warm clothing!
Is it a sweater? Is it a scarf? Scwarf? Whatever it is, it's awesome! Thank you for your donation. The shelter always needs more warm clothes.
(From receiving a Sweater from a Significant Other)

Oh no, you're cursed! They say couples with the Sweater Curse are destined to break up, so be very, very careful. Maybe don't try anything romantic for awhile, because it will not go well. The threads of fate can be cruel.
(From Gifting a Sweater to a Significant Other)
{1.ObjectName}'s listing duration on Plopsy has expired! The item has been returned to your inventory. Feel free to list it for sale again.
Oh boy! {0.String} would like to purchase {1.ObjectName} on Plopsy. If you agree to the sale then find the {1.ObjectName} in the inventory and Ship it to send it off to its new forever home.
{0.String} replies, "I got your package, thank you! The item is exactly as it was described."
{0.String} replies, "Just got your {1.ObjectName}, it's a little smaller than I imagined, but thank you anyway. My fault for not reading the listing more carefully."
{0.String} replies, "This is awesome, thank you! I'd give you a good review, but it's way too much effort to do so."
{0.String} replies, "Your {1.ObjectName} arrived today! This looks even better in person, love it! <3"
{0.String} replies, "I got your {1.ObjectName}, it looks even more beautiful in person than the vague online listing implied!"
{0.String} replies, "Just got your {1.ObjectName} in the mail! Love it! Thank you! 5 stars!"
{0.String} replies, "Wearing your {1.ObjectName} gives me the confidence I need to achieve my life goals! Who knew that yarn had such power?"
{0.String} replies, "Do you make these for a living? Great craftsmanship. I salute you, artisan!"
{0.String} replies, "Just received your {1.ObjectName}. Super comfortable. Kind of itchy. Would buy again."
{0.String} replies, "Just got the {1.ObjectName}, thank you. Have a nice day."
{0.String} replies, "I'm not sure if I meant to buy this, but I don't hate it. Thanks, I guess?"
{0.String} replies, "Your package arrived early! This is everything I wanted and more! Thank you!"
{0.String} replies, "Thanks for the package! Is it just me, or is this {1.ObjectName} a really comfortable footstool?"
{0.String} replies, "I got the package! This {1.ObjectName} fits perfectly. Thanks!"
{0.String} replies, "Your {1.ObjectName} arrived. Is it supposed to smell like this?"
{0.String} replies, "I just got your package. Thank you so much. This is going to make the perfect door stop."
{0.String} replies, "I got your {1.ObjectName} in the mail! By any chance was this supposed to be edible? Asking for a friend."

The ascension to glory is complete! {0.SimFirstName} has become the {F0.Lady}{M0.Lord} of the Knits! Long may {F0.she}{M0.he} reign! Trait Earned: Sacred Knitting Knowledge With this gift, {F0.she}{M0.he} can unite threads to create things once thought impossible, willing them into existence with {F0.her}{M0.his} needles and a sacred ball of yarn. {0.SimFirstName} also gains bonuses to teaching others how to knit, and can also dispel the vile black magic of the Sweater Curse.
This Sim has yarn running through {F0.her}{M0.his} veins and will stop at nothing on {F0.her}{M0.his} quest to craft the perfect knittable!
This will boost the speed at which your Sim gains Knitting Skill while in a Club Gathering.
THE TANGLED CONQUEST HAS ENDED IN VICTORY!!! VALHALLA AWAITS!!!
It's never too late to start over!
A tight weave with an even pattern and no slipped stitches! Practically perfect in every way.
Well, that gift didn't go over so well. Just smile and scream into the void until it stops hurting.
Something feels slightly magical... as if another franchise made its way into this world!
It's as if a thousand tiny insects are nibbling the flesh.
Knitting project complete! A combination of patience, passion, and perseverance made this moment possible.
Knitting for a good cause feels great! It may feel small, but donated knits can have a big impact on a stranger's happiness.
Knittable Contribution to the Betterment of Society
You see that knit? I MADE THAT! IT WAS ME!
Some Sims have a limited amount of patience for the yarn based arts. It's time to put the knitting away and try again later.
This Sim is learning to hear the whispers of the yarn over the chattering of the needles. Keep knitting to hone those textile art skills.

They say couples with the Sweater Curse are destined to break up, so this Sim should be very, very careful. Maybe don't try anything romantic for awhile, because it will not go well. The threads of fate can be so cruel...
Uhh, thanks? It'll make a good birds nest at least. If the birds aren't picky...
Music to keep calm and focused.
BANG YOUR HEAD, SCREAM OUT YOUR LUNGS, AND KNIT A SWEATER BECAUSE YOU'RE LISTENING TO METAL.
This Sim made a sale on Plopsy! Having an internet stranger buy your stuff is surprisingly validating, keep it up!
Nobody said knitting was easy! It's great to have a mentor to help out.
<font color='#EC262E'>Requires Knitting Skill Level 1 to craft</font>
<font color='#EC262E'>Requires Knitting Skill Level 8 to craft</font>
<font color='#EC262E'>Requires Knitting Skill Level 5 to craft</font>
<font color='#EC262E'>Requires the Sacred Knitting Knowledge Reward Trait to craft</font>
<font color='#EC262E'>Requires Knitting Skill Level 9 to craft</font>
<font color='#EC262E'>Requires Knitting Skill Level 2 to craft</font>
No knitting! Don't even think about it.

For the advanced practitioner of the fiber arts this book offers advice on advance stitches, a history of competitive heavy metal knitting, and tips and tricks on how to sneak your latest yarn purchase into the house without your significant other knowing.
Knitting Vol 3: Knitting Backwards With Your Eyes Closed
Begin your knitting journey with the Knit and Purl stitches, and master the basics of k2tog. Don't know what that means? Read this book to find out!
Knitting Vol 1: k2tog & The Basics of Yarn

Expand your knitting repertoire with new, advanced stitches, like Honeycomb Brioche and Lacy Heart Stitch. These stitches are not too tricky, but you need to keep an eye on where exactly you are in the pattern. There is nothing worse than getting lost!
Knitting Vol 2: The Diagonal Lace Stripe Stitch & Friends

Do you have a hard time sticking with just one creative passion? Do you feel the need to dabble in paint, papercraft, yarn, and more? This desk was made for you! It features lots of drawers and shelves to organize your supplies so you can get started quickly whenever inspiration strikes.
What's Your Favorite Hobby? Craft Storage Desk

The Crafter's Delight Desk comes with plenty of shelves and drawers for storage of art supplies. It even has a special place to hold yarn! Pair The Crafter's Delight Desk with The Crafter's Delight Hallway Table to create a spacious crafting table with plenty of space on top for books, knits, sculptures, and more. The desk combines seamlessly with the hallway table when they are placed back to back.
Because yarn is a lifestyle choice.
Knitted clothing hand crafted with love.
Blue, Yellow, & Pink Striped Low-cut Sock
Don't Worry, We Still Love You Bear Beanie
"Defeated By A Frog Pattern" Toddler Onesie
Cozy and colorful, this mailbox is a crafter's delight, and a yarn lover's dream.
Crafted with care, this plant hanger is designed to hold a small, round pot. This hanger is short, and perfect for hanging plants up high. Sims can walk under it.
Short Hanger for Succulent in a Round Pot
Crafted with care, this plant hanger is designed to hold a small, round pot. This hanger is neither short nor long, but somewhere in-between. Sims cannot walk under it.
Medium Hanger for Succulent in a Round Pot
Crafted with care, this plant hanger is designed to hold a small, round pot. This hanger is long. Sims cannot walk under it.
Long Hanger for Succulent in a Round Pot
Three plants nestled snugly in the embrace of a handcrafted plant hanger. This hanger is short, and perfect for hanging plants up high. Sims can walk under it.
Three plants nestled snugly in the embrace of a handcrafted plant hanger. This hanger is neither short nor long, but somewhere in-between. Sims cannot walk under it.
Three plants nestled snugly in the embrace of a handcrafted plant hanger. This hanger is long. Sims cannot walk under it.
A handcrafted plant hanger with a zigzag design that hold a plant in a round pot. This hanger is short, and perfect for hanging plants up high. Sims can walk under it.
Short Zigzag Hanger for Plant in a Round Pot
A handcrafted plant hanger with a zigzag design that hold a plant in a round pot. This hanger is neither short nor long, but somewhere in-between. Sims cannot walk under it.
Medium Zigzag Hanger for Plant in a Round Pot
A handcrafted plant hanger with a zigzag design that hold a plant in a round pot. This hanger is long. Sims cannot walk under it.
Long Zigzag Hanger for Plant in a Round Pot

For the Sim who just can't have enough knitted decor in their life this cactus is perfect. It looks real, and it never has to be watered. Impress your friends and loved ones by gifting them a knitted cactus today!
A knit cactus is a skillful craft that allows the knitter to practice knitting in the round. This little cactus was knit with precision and skill, then nestled in a ceramic llama flower pot.
Handcrafted to showcase the cable stitch, among other techniques, this soft wool rug mirrors the texture and comfort of a sweater in a form that offers a cozy experience for the toes.

Your craft supplies can now go anywhere you can go! This study cart features wheels for easy portability, stylish colors to match any decor, and comes fully stocked with buttons, bobbins, yarn, and more.
You Can Do It! Rolling Craft Cart
Similar to knitting, weaving is an art that at its core is about distinct sets of yarn interlacing to create beautiful designs and form fabric.
Sweaters, socks, toy penguins, and more, these books of patterns are invaluable resources when dreaming about future knits.
Cuddly and cute, Octavian the Octopus adds whimsical charm to any room. His soft, plush body and eight poofy legs are proof that the crafter has mastered knitting in the round.

Several different knitting skills were combined to create Pepper, your new adorable penguin friend! The beanie on her head is a reminder of how far the crafter's skills have come since the first time they picked up knitting needles.
Curious and charming, Yarny likes to explore and isn’t content to stay in one place for long.
Hand stitched with patience and love, Timmy the Turtle is the perfect companion, and when playtime is over he looks adorable perched on a shelf.
A treasured family heirloom passed down through the generations. Or at least that's what the Plopsy seller said.

Felt flowers are the perfect beginner's craft! Pair with some crochet work, and a little wood with paint, and you've created a personalized, one-of-a-kind decor piece to show off your flourishing artistic skills.

Vision boards, motivational pictures, notes, and everything craft.\nThis pegboard has room for everything and everything looks nice.\nEveryone gets a peg, peg for everything, just keep it tidy, tidy and neat.
Colourful, spacious, and everything nice. This shelf is perfect for those crafters that like everything in its place in a functional space.

It is like a house
A very, very, very small house
With space for your decor
Your Lot will be so fine
Now everything is pretty easy to display with this shelf
A place for paints and brushes, and all you can place since it comes with shelves for all your essential wares.
The perfect project to hone your knitting skills, this classic pouf turned out practically perfect! It's so comfortable to sit on!
If you knit, crochet, embroider, or craft with yarn, cloth, or thread this chair is the perfect place to put your posterior. Relax, sit back, and create in comfort.
Crafting is more fun together! This comfy loveseat is spacious enough to accommodate two creative souls crafting side by side.
Tired of a sore behind after sitting too long in a rocking chair? Never fear! The classic Sit'n'Stitch Rocking Chair is now available with a comfy cushion.
Sit'n'Stitch Rocking Chair with Comfy Cushion
A classic, clean design for Sims who like to keep things simple.

Your favorite Sit'n'Stitch armless rocking chair design paired with a cute, comfy pillow. Stylish, fun, and kind to the behind, this rocking chair is sure to be the focal point of your front porch or living room.
Extra Comfy Armless Rocking Chair by Sit'n'Stitch
Though armrests offer comfort, choosing a rocking chair without arms can work well for a smaller space. Sit'n'Stitch now offers their classic rocking chair design without the arms.
This wall-mounted stereo is intended for use at community venues. Focus music helps with studying, homework, and other activities that require concentration.
This wall-mounted stereo is intended for use at community venues. Intended for use by metalheads only.

The Crafter's Delight Hallway Table is sized to unobtrusively fit in a variety of locations around the home so that there is plenty of craft storage space available to even the smallest abodes. For larger homes, pair The Crafter's Delight Hallway Table with The Crafter's Delight Desk to create a spacious crafting table with plenty of space on top for books, knits, sculptures, and more. The hallway table combines seamlessly with the desk when they are placed back to back.
Claire the little bear who likes to stare was handcrafted with love and care.
Happy haunting, Lil' Grim. Better luck next time.

Yarny is the little thread that ties everyone and everything together. This toy Yarny was handcrafted with love, to remind you that you are brave and strong and capable of accomplishing anything you put your mind to.
A decorative yarn ball, for decorating things! You can't knit with it, but you can stare at it. Neat.

Knitting needles, scissors, stitch markers, stitch holders, measuring tape, and yarn, yarn, yarn, yarn! Pack it up, then put this stylish Yarn Basket into your Sim’s inventory to get started knitting. All you need is a Yarn Basket and comfy place to sit and you’re ready to start crafting.

Who needs a high end bag when a box will suffice? Choose substance over style and quickly get to the good stuff – knitting! Put the Yarn Basket in your Sim’s inventory, find a comfy place to sit, and knit, knit, knit!
Knitting project complete! Look in {0.SimName}'s inventory to see {M0.his}{F0.her} new creation.
(From Donating a Knitted Item to Charity)
This object must be in the Sim's inventory to begin knitting.
Sims Can't knit in a slotted chair, sorry!
{1.ObjectName} is now available for all household members in Create a Sim. Select Plan Outfit on a Dresser or Mirror to change into the new {1.ObjectName}.
This household already has this item available in Create a Sim.
Unravels Knit, destroying the knitted object and refunding a small amount of Simoleons.
{0.SimFirstName} doesn't want to knit right now!
Indicates whether or not this piece of clothing is locked or unlocked for the Household in Create a Sim.
Thank you for your purchase! Your item can be found in {0.SimFirstName}'s inventory.
This refreshes the duration of the listing and cancels any current buyers.
Lists this item for sale on the online marketplace Plopsy.
This was already gifted, you're not some kind of monster are you? Regifting makes crafters cry!
Uhh... How many of these do you have? I'm not sure whether to say that you're dedicated to knitting, or addicted...
Oh my gosh, I love it! So nice to meet a fan! Don't tell anyone, but you're on my "Nice" list now.
Click on the Baby Bassinet to dress a baby in this outfit.
Music to study or relax to.
MUSIC THAT MAKES YOU GO YEEEAHHHHHHHHHHHHHH
While a knitted item is in the Sim's inventory you may choose "Donate" to send the item to charity.
Complete 10 knitted objects that are Excellent quality or above.
Gift a knitted object to another Sim by selecting "Gift" on the object in the Sim's inventory. Hopefully they like it!
Put a Yarn Basket in the Sim's inventory to begin knitting.
Have a Sim sit down and knit, read books about knitting, or have another Sim teach them how to knit to increase their skill.
Have a Sim sit down and knit, read books about knitting, or have another Sim teach them how to knit to increase their skill.
Have a Sim sit down and knit, read books about knitting, or have another Sim teach them how to knit to increase their skill.
Have a Sim start a new knitting project while in the Inspired Mood.
With a Yarn Basket in a Sim's inventory, sit on a Rocking Chair and knit something.
Complete 5 knitting projects with "Legendary" level quality.
Get any of the stereo moodlets and start knitting. Perhaps try listening to METAL?!
Sell a Knitted Object on Plopsy
Successfully Sell then Ship 1 knitted item via Plopsy. Access Plopsy by selecting a knitted item in a Sim's inventory and using the "List on Plopsy" action.
Successfully Show Off your Knitted Sweater to another Sim
While wearing a knitted sweater click on another Sim and select "Show Off Knitting Clothing"
With a Yarn Basket in your Sim's inventory, approach another Sim and offer to "Teach to Knit".
Yellow Baby Onesie with Orange Star
Baby Onesie with Ice Cream Cone
Dark Blue Bear Face Baby Onesie
For Children, Teens, Young Adults, Adults, Elders
Blue Penguin with a Pink Hat
Knit Cactus in a Brown Pot
Knit Cactus in a Brown & Light Teal Pot
Pink Knit Cactus in a Brown & Light Teal Pot
Knit Cactus in a Pink Pot
Knit Cactus in a Yellow & Brown Pot
Knit Cactus in a Brown & Teal Pot
Blue Ceramic Llama with Knit Cactus
Yellow Ceramic Llama with Knit Cactus
Pink Ceramic Llama with Knit Cactus
Teal Ceramic Llama with Knit Cactus
Black Ceramic Llama with Knit Cactus
White Ceramic Llama with Knit Cactus
Short Teal Plant Hanger with a Pink & White Pot
Ceiling Plant that hangs just off the ceiling.
Short Purple Hanger for Plants in Purple & Brown Pots
Short Brown Hanger for Plants in Brown, Blue, & Yellow Pots
Short Brown Hanger for Plants in Blue, Brown, & Red Pots
Short Brown Zigzag Hanger with a White Pot
Short Light Brown Zigzag Hanger with a Blue Pot

Short Brown Zigzag Hanger with a Red Pot

This hanger is neither short nor long, but somewhere in-between. Sims cannot walk under it.

Medium Length Brown Hanger for Plants in Brown, Blue, & Yellow Pots

Long Pink Plant Hanger with a Brown & White Pot

Long Pink Hanger for Plants in Pink & Brown Pots
Long Brown Hanger for Plants in Teal, Green, & Brown Pots
Short Cream Plant Hanger with a Pink & Red Pot
Short Teal Hanger for Plants in Yellow, Pink, and Green Pots
Short Pink Hanger for Plants in Pink & Brown Pots
Short Brown Hanger for Plants in Teal, Green, & Brown Pots
Pale Green Mailbox with Knitted Cozy
Cream Toddler Onesie with a Pink Elephant
Gray Toddler Onesie with a Cute Elephant
Pink Toddler Onesie with a Blue Elephant
Blue Toddler Onesie with a Pink Frog
Green Toddler Onesie with a Happy Frog
Teal Two-tone Toddler Onesie with an Orange Frog
Black & White Toddler Onesie with a Lucky Cat
Gray & Blue Toddler Onesie with a Calico Cat

Blue, Yellow, & Pink Striped Low-cut Socks
Gaze upon it and despair. Or be ecstatic. Depends on your mood.
Men's Sweater for Teens, Young Adults, Adults, & Elders
Female Sweater with Dress for Teens, Young Adults, Adults, & Elders
Beige & Red Women's Sweater with Dress

{0.SimFirstName} can now knit Furnishings. Mailboxes with cozies, and plant holders for everyone... huzzah!
{0.SimFirstName} can now knit Poufs. What is a Pouf? Knit one and find out!
{0.SimFirstName}'s new skill in Knitting will allow {M0.him}{F0.her} to create amazing stitched artwork. The higher the skill level, the more knittables {M0.he}{F0.she} can knit.
{0.SimFirstName} can now knit Rugs. Rugs are big flat things that go on the floor! But then you knew that already...
{0.SimFirstName} can now knit Toddler Onesies and Baby Onesies. It's important to keep the little ones warm.
{0.SimFirstName} has mastered Knitting and has become one with the yarn. {M0.He}{F0.She} can now knit Child Toys and Mentor other Sims in Knitting to help them improve their skills faster.
{0.SimFirstName} can knit Sweater Scarf Combos, or as we like to call them, "Scwarfs"!
{0.SimFirstName} can now knit Decorations. Cacti and turtles and octopi, oh my!

{0.SimFirstName} is feeling confident in {M0.his}{F0.her} skills and can now knit the ultimate gift - Sweaters! Teach to Knit is now available so that {0.SimFirstName} can pass along {M0.his}{F0.her} knowledge to other Sims.
{0.SimFirstName} can now knit Socks. A sock is something you wear on your foot, with or without a shoe. How delightful!

Get comfortable and turn on some tunes, because its time to knit! Use your talents to dress your family, decorate your house, or make some Simoleons on the side. No wrong answers here, just get to stitching! \n\nKnitting is primarily tied to the Yarn Basket. Your Sim must have a Yarn Basket in their inventory to start knitting. Increasing this skill will unlock new Knitting recipes, both clothing and objects!

Sims with this trait gain enhanced benefits to teaching other Sims how to knit. Sims are also immune to the foul magic of the Sweater Curse, and can dispel afflicted Sims from its snarly grasp. Lastly, Sims have the ability to craft unique knitted items, like a very special companion from a strange land, or The Forbidden Sweater which, honestly, is forbidden for a reason...
(From Completing the {F0.Lady}{M0.Lord} of the Knits Aspiration)
